2.text: And Pilate asked him, Art thou the King of the Jews? And he answering saith unto him, Thou sayest.

3.text: And the chief priests accused him of many things.

4.text: And Pilate again asked him, saying, Answerest thou nothing? behold how many things they accuse thee of.

5.text: But Jesus no more answered anything; insomuch that Pilate marvelled.

6.text: Now at the feast he used to release unto them one prisoner, whom they asked of him.

7.text: And there was one called Barabbas, lying bound with them that had made insurrection, men who in the insurrection had committed murder.

8.text: And the multitude went up and began to ask him to do as he was wont to do unto them.

9.text: And Pilate answered them, saying, Will ye that I release unto you the King of the Jews?

10.text: For he perceived that for envy the chief priests had delivered him up.

11.text: But the chief priests stirred up the multitude, that he should rather release Barabbas unto them.

12.text: And Pilate again answered and said unto them, What then shall I do unto him whom ye call the King of the Jews?

13.text: And they cried out again, Crucify him.

14.text: And Pilate said unto them, Why, what evil hath he done? But they cried out exceedingly, Crucify him.

15.text: And Pilate, wishing to content the multitude, released unto them Barabbas, and delivered Jesus, when he had scourged him, to be crucified.

16.text: And the soldiers led him away within the court, which is the Prætorium; and they call together the whole band.

17.text: And they clothe him with purple, and platting a crown of thorns, they put it on him;

18.text: and they began to salute him, Hail, King of the Jews!

19.text: And they smote his head with a reed, and spat upon him, and bowing their knees worshipped him.

20.text: And when they had mocked him, they took off from him the purple, and put on him his garments. And they lead him out to crucify him.

21.text: And they compel one passing by, Simon of Cyrene, coming from the country, the father of Alexander and Rufus, to go with them, that he might bear his cross.

22.text: And they bring him unto the place Golgotha, which is, being interpreted, The place of a skull.

23.text: And they offered him wine mingled with myrrh: but he received it not.

24.text: And they crucify him, and part his garments among them, casting lots upon them, what each should take.

25.text: And it was the third hour, and they crucified him.

26.text: And the superscription of his accusation was written over, THE KING OF THE JEWS.

27.text: And with him they crucify two robbers; one on his right hand, and one on his left.

29.text: And they that passed by railed on him, wagging their heads, and saying, Ha! thou that destroyest the temple, and buildest it in three days,

30.text: save thyself, and come down from the cross.

31.text: In like manner also the chief priests mocking him among themselves with the scribes said, He saved others; himself he cannot save.

32.text: Let the Christ, the King of Israel, now come down from the cross, that we may see and believe. And they that were crucified with him reproached him.

33.text: And when the sixth hour was come, there was darkness over the whole land until the ninth hour.

34.text: And at the ninth hour Jesus cried with a loud voice, Eloi, Eloi, lama sabachthani? which is, being interpreted, My God, my God, why hast thou forsaken me?

35.text: And some of them that stood by, when they heard it, said, Behold, he calleth Elijah.

36.text: And one ran, and filling a sponge full of vinegar, put it on a reed, and gave him to drink, saying, Let be; let us see whether Elijah cometh to take him down.

37.text: And Jesus uttered a loud voice, and gave up the ghost.

38.text: And the veil of the temple was rent in two from the top to the bottom.

39.text: And when the centurion, who stood by over against him, saw that he so gave up the ghost, he said, Truly this man was the Son of God.

40.text: And there were also women beholding from afar: among whom were both Mary Magdalene, and Mary the mother of James the less and of Joses, and Salome;

41.text: who, when he was in Galilee, followed him, and ministered unto him; and many other women that came up with him unto Jerusalem.

42.text: And when even was now come, because it was the Preparation, that is, the day before the sabbath,

43.text: there came Joseph of Arimathæa, a councillor of honorable estate, who also himself was looking for the kingdom of God; and he boldly went in unto Pilate, and asked for the body of Jesus.

44.text: And Pilate marvelled if he were already dead: and calling unto him the centurion, he asked him whether he had been any while dead.

45.text: And when he learned it of the centurion, he granted the corpse to Joseph.

46.text: And he bought a linen cloth, and taking him down, wound him in the linen cloth, and laid him in a tomb which had been hewn out of a rock; and he rolled a stone against the door of the tomb.

47.text: And Mary Magdalene and Mary the mother of Joses beheld where he was laid.
